verses.verse: A gentle reply turns away wrath, but a harsh word arouses anger.
The tongue of the wise distills knowledge, but the mouth of a fool utters nothing except folly.[b]
The eyes of the LORD are everywhere,[c] keeping a close watch on the evil and the good.
A wholesome tongue is a tree of life, but an undisciplined tongue crushes the spirit.
A fool spurns his father’s correction, but whoever heeds admonition is prudent.
In the house of the righteous there is no lack of treasures, but the earnings of the wicked are never secure.
The lips of the wise spread knowledge; such is not true of the heart of a fool.
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD,[d] but he delights in the prayer of the upright.
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, but he loves anyone whose goal is righteousness.
Severe punishment awaits the one who strays from the right path; whoever hates a rebuke will die.
The netherworld and the abyss lie open to the LORD; how much more is this true of the human heart.[e]
A scoffer[f] does not like to be reproved, and he refuses to consult the wise.
A glad heart makes the face cheerful, but anguish of heart breaks one’s spirit.
The mind of one who is wise seeks further knowledge, but the mouth of a fool feeds on folly.
Every day is wretched for those who are sorrowing, but to one who is cheerful, every day is a perpetual feast.[g]
It is better to have a little and fear the LORD[h] than to possess immense wealth and suffer anguish.
Better a dish of herbs served with love than a fattened ox accompanied by hatred.
An ill-tempered man provokes quarrels, but a patient man quiets dissension.
The path of the idler[i] is covered with thorns, but the path of the upright is a broad highway.
A wise son is a joy to his father, but a foolish son has no respect for his mother.
Folly delights the one without sense, but a man of understanding follows a straight path.
Plans miscarry when counsel is lacking, but they succeed when there are many counselors.
A man is joyful when he utters apt answers, and even more satisfying is a word in season.
The path of life leads upward for the prudent man so that he may escape going down to the netherworld.[j]
The LORD tears down the proud man’s house,[k] but he preserves the widow’s boundaries.
The LORD abhors the thoughts of the wicked, but he is pleased with the words of the pure.
He who is greedy for dishonest gain brings disaster on a house, but he who refuses to accept bribes will have life.
The righteous man reflects before answering, but the mouth of the wicked pours out evil.
The LORD keeps his distance from the wicked, but he listens to the prayer of the righteous.
A kindly glance gives joy to the heart, and good news refreshes the bones.
He who accepts saving reproof has life and will enjoy the company of the wise.
He who rejects correction despises himself, but whoever accepts admonition will gain understanding.
The fear of the LORD[l] provides instruction in wisdom, and to be humble is the way to honor.
